revised_title: Monsieur Auzout's Speculations on Lunar and Earthly Changes
tldr: Monsieur Auzout speculates on the changes that might be observed in the Earth and Moon by their respective inhabitants. He discusses the differences in appearance of the Earth and Moon during various seasons and the potential for observing changes in the Moon's surface through the use of telescopes. Auzout also considers the possibility of the Moon having seas on one hemisphere and not turning on its axis, as well as the absence of crepuscule on the Moon.
